      static Point Algorithms.massCenter(java.util.ArrayList<Point> points)
      Given a list of points of a convex polygon, calculates the mass center, which is the point (x,y), where x is equal to the sum of all the x-coordinates of every point divided by n and y is the sum of all the y-coordinates of every point in the list divided by n.

      static Line Algorithms.hamSandwich(java.lang.Double pendant, Point[] points, int pointsOnSide, processing.core.PApplet applet)
      Given a set of points, a pendant and a natural k number, it finds a line which divides the set in two parts, leaving k points in one side(left) of the line and the rest of points in the other(right).
      static Line Algorithms.hamSandwich(java.lang.Double pendant, Point[] points, processing.core.PApplet applet)
      Given a set of points and a pendant, it finds a line which divides the set in two parts, leaving the half of points in one side of the line and the rest of points in the other, if the length of the set is odd it rounds half up the set

      static Point Algorithms.massCenter(java.util.ArrayList<Point> points)
      Given a list of points of a convex polygon, calculates the mass center, which is the point (x,y), where x is equal to the sum of all the x-coordinates of every point divided by n and y is the sum of all the y-coordinates of every point in the list divided by n.
